meanings.definition: A type of fabric made from wool or worsted yarn.
meanings.sent1: I bought a cozy tammy scarf for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used tammy to make a warm blanket.
meanings.sent3: The tammy fabric felt soft against my skin.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was as smooth as a piece of tammy.
meanings.sent5: The tammy material kept me warm on chilly nights.

meanings.definition: To strain or filter through a tammy cloth.
meanings.sent1: She had to tammy the soup to remove the lumps.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a tammy cloth to strain the sauce.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tammyed the coffee grounds into my cup.
meanings.sent4: The tea was tammyed to perfection, free of any residue.
meanings.sent5: He tammyed the mixture carefully to get a smooth texture.

meanings.sent1: Tammy is a kind and friendly person.
meanings.sent2: I met Tammy at the park yesterday.
meanings.sent3: Tammy's smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: She waved goodbye to Tammy as she left the party.
meanings.sent5: Everyone loves spending time with Tammy.
